item.title: California Pitcher Plant - Cobra Lily (Darlingtonia californica)
item.description: Spring is in full swing in the higher elevations around Mount Shasta and the surrounding ranges. I am always struck by the large patches of Cobra Lilies that grow along nutrient poor seeps in alpine meadows. I nearly always stop to take some photos and take in all the cool colors and shapes when out on training runs or hikes. I have made many observations of these over the past few years, but here is a quick post to pull out observations from GBIF.
